protocol.name: P-MEXP-7779
protocol.text: The growth chamber conditions were: 16/8 hrs (d/n) with white light (Neon tubes, cool white), 100 µEm-²h-1 PAR and 20 °C.  60 seeds were sowed in per 150 x 25 mm round dish, sealed with Urgopore tape and placed in darkness at 4oC for 3 days.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-7780
protocol.text: Plants of the wild-type Landsberg erecta Ler and 4 narrow leaf mutants elongata2, elongata3, elongata4, angusta4 (Berna et al., 1999) and drl1-2 (Nelissen et al., 2003)(Nottingham Seed Stock Center (NASC) code is N9360).  The shoot apex of plants (comprising shoot apex meristem, first and second leaf primordia at petiole-less stage) were harvested at the growth stage 1.0 removing the cotyledons and the hypocotyls and at least 4 hours after the beginning of the photoperiod when photosynthetic and metabolic activities of plants are stable (Boyes et al., 2001). The age of the plants at the harvesting step were between 11 and 18 days after sowing depending of the delay in mutant development.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-7781
protocol.text: The experimental design comprised 3 replicates of each genotype, one replicate corresponding to one RNA extraction on a independent pool of about 150 plant apex.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-7782
protocol.text: Total RNA was isolated using Trizol Reagent (Life Technologies Gaithersburg MD, USA)

protocol.name: P-MEXP-7784
text: Affymetrix  Hybridisation protocol for ARE-ATH1 array  The hybridisation protocol is derived from the “GeneChip® Expression Analysis Technical Manual” (Section 2 Eukaryotic sample and array processing). The document can be found at the affymetrix website:

Within this document (expression_s2_manual.pdf), the following sections are applicable for the hybridization protocol:  2.2.3 Eukaryotic Target Hybridization 2.2.5 Reagents and Materials Required 2.2.6 Reagent Preparation 2.2.7-2.2.8 Eukaryotic Target Hybridization 2.3.3 Eukaryotic Arrays: Washing and staining 2.3.5 Reagents and Materials Required 2.3.6 Reagent Preparation 2.3.7 - 2.3.8 Experiment and Fluidics Station Setup 2.3.9 -2.3.14 Probe Array Wash and Stain

protocol.name: P-MEXP-7785
protocol.text: Data were normalized using the Affy library from Bioconductor. First all the CEL files of the were read, by means of ReadAffy. Subsequently the data were normalized using the GCRMA procedure.  ex: R procedure using Bioconductor > library(affy) > Data<-ReadAffy(widget=T) > Data AffyBatch object size of arrays=712x712 features (23768 kb) cdf=ATH1-121501 (22810 affyids) number of samples=6 number of genes=22810 annotation=ath1121501 > library(gcrma) > eset1<-gcrma(Data) Computing affinities.Done. Adjusting for optical effect......Done. Adjusting for non-specific binding......Done. Normalizing Calculating Expression

protocol.name: P-MEXP-8074
text: Affymetrix  Labelling protocol for ARE-ATH1 array  The labelling protocol is applicable for use with the GeneChip ARE-ATH1 when starting with a minimal amount of 5ug total RNA.  The protocol is derived from the “GeneChip® Expression Analysis Technical Manual” (Section 2 Eukaryotic sample and array processing). The document can be found at the affymetrix website:

Within this document (expression_s2_manual.pdf), the following sections are applicable for the labelling protocol:  2.1.3 Eukaryotic Target Preparation 2.1.7 - 2.1.8 Reagents and Materials Required 2.1.13 - 2.1.18 One-Cycle cDNA Synthesis  2.1.32 - 2.1.33 Cleanup of Double Stranded cDNA for Both the One-Cycle and Two-Cycle Target Labelling Assays 2.1.34 - 2.1.35 Synthesis of Biotin-Labelled cRNA for both the One-Cycle and Two-Cycle Target Labelling Assays. 2.1.36 2.1.38– Cleanup and Quantification of Biotin-Labelled cRNA 2.1.39 – 2.1.40 Fragmenting the cRNA for Target Preparation

protocol.name: Affymetrix ATH1
text: The scanning protocol is derived from the “GeneChip® Expression Analysis Technical Manual” (Section 2   Eukaryotic sample and array processing). The document can be found at the affymetrix website:

Within this document (expression_s2_manual.pdf), the following sections are applicable for the protocol:  2.3.15 - 2.3.17 Probe Array Scan  The Scanner is controlled by Affymetrix GeneChip Operating Software (GCOS version 1.1.2). The probe array is   scanned after the wash protocols are complete. Make sure the laser is warmed up prior to scanning by turning it on at least 10 minutes (specific for   Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000). If the probe array was stored at 4C, warm to room temperature before   scanning.

protocol.name: GCRMA
protocol.text: ata were normalized using the Affy library from Bioconductor. First all the CEL files of the were read, by means of ReadAffy. Subsequently the data were normalized using the GCRMA procedure.  ex: R procedure using Bioconductor > library(affy) > Data<-ReadAffy(widget=T) > Data AffyBatch object size of arrays=712x712 features (23768 kb) cdf=ATH1-121501 (22810 affyids) number of samples=6 number of genes=22810 annotation=ath1121501 > library(gcrma) > eset1<-gcrma(Data) Computing affinities.Done. Adjusting for optical effect......Done. Adjusting for non-specific binding......Done. Normalizing Calculating Expression
